Intents.description: querying or analyzing the data, doesn't change the underlying spreadsheet
creating and managing the reports, figures, graphs, charts, or dashboard
update the values to clean things up, such as data validation or removing duplicates
manipulate or change the shape or structure of the spreadsheet
identifying issues such as outliers, anomalies, null values or typos to devise a plan of action
connected to chit chat, FAQs or other utterances of a conversational nature
private intents that can only be triggered interally by the agent

Dacts.description: Non-data related subjects which do not require access to the table. Agent does not need to take any actions, and can simply respond.
filtering, grouping, and sorting the data in some fashion as part of a SQL query
calculating a specific metric such as LTV, Retention, or ROAS. Usually a multi-turn process for determining the formula.
creating a visual graph, chart, figure, or diagram from the data
pulling meta-data, such as schema information, answering questions found in a FAQ, or other pre-computed facts.
adding information into the table, such as new columns, likely referencing other cells through a formula
updating or filling in values, does *not* include transforms on data type (ie. currency or datetime)
removing or hiding rows or columns, often based on some criteria
explain user actions or user generated information, commonly used in conjunction to store or retrieve user preferences
inquire what the agent said or did, including the past actions and motivations of the agent. always include a target entity for inquiry
Noun, often used compositionally. When appearing alone, it means the user referenced the table without specifying an instruction
Noun, often used compositionally. When appearing alone, it means the user referenced some rows without specifying an instruction
Noun, often used compositionally. When appearing alone, it means the user referenced some columns without specifying an instruction
Adjective, often used compositionally. It represents many, repeated, double, or multiple of something.
accepting an agent's proposed change, showing satisfaction, or otherwise expressing positive sentiment: Yes, sounds good
dismiss the agent's suggestions, displaying confusion, or otherwise expressing negative sentiment: It's fine, let's just ignore it
requesting guidance on multi-step analysis, such as Cohort Analysis, A/B Testing evaluation, or Multi-touch attribution.
making and modifying pivot tables with multiple groupings, including range selection for filtering
when the user wants to know more about the schema or other pre-computed table data
find out if a certain column or piece of information exists in the data
pulling an metric definition from stored meta-data to inform how it is calculated
defining new metric definitions that persist across conversations
applying analysis to existing plot or diagram, namely trendlines or clustering
writing out any text to summarize or present information within a chart or figure
creating and managing reports, such as generating recurring reports across multiple weeks
saving a chart or figure to the dashboard or download as a file
change the design or formatting elements to update an existing figure or chart
style a table with an updated view or design elements such as bold or underline
validate the data within the column as belonging to a predefined set
standardize the data within the column to conform to a specific format
flash fill the blanks within a column based on some pattern offered by the user
fill in missing values within the column based on the observed or external data
set the data type of the column to a specific subtype from the ontology
revert the most recent change, equivalent to an 'undo' button
persisting a new definition for user preferences such as meaning of 'recent' or 'best'
delete duplicate or repeated rows from a table given a set of columns
transpose rows into columns or columns into rows, can also perform stacking
move values from one place to another, effectively performing a cut-and-paste operation
text-to-columns, inserts new columns by splitting a single column into multiple ones based on a delimiter
store direct or derived table as a materialized view or export to CSV
joining two tables together for data integration, likely involves cleaning along the way
a special case of joining tables where both table share the same columns so they can be concatenated vertically
merge multiple columns together into a single column
call an external API to retrieve a new table
resolving issues with empty, nulls, blanks, or otherwise missing values
identifying potential concerns, namely outliers, anomalies, date issues or location issues
open-ended request to combine or join two sources of data
delete similar, but distinct, terms by merging them into a single value
identifying potential problems, namely mixed types and subtypes of data such as a currency mixed with whole numbers
open-ended request to fix multiple issues within the table
generic, open-ended questions about the spreadsheet: 'Any interesting insights in this data?'
pulling user preferences to determine how the agent arrived at a particular answer
asking the agent for recommendations on how to proceed with next steps
expressing approval over the agent's actions, but with curiosity about next steps: 'Sounds good, what's next?'
questioning the response, implying the agent should explain their reasoning process: 'Are you sure about that?'
Generate a thought or call a stronger model to think deeper about a problem
First peek at a few rows of the source or target columns before deciding what to do next
First search meta-data such as schema or issue information before moving forward
Perform arithmetic or data science computations that do not change the underlying data
Combines query action and materialize view to stage a derived table for further analysis
First consider if any user preferences are relevant before taking the next action
An agent only dialog act that signifies the agent is not confident about the situation
